oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Leguminosen als Zwischenbegrünung im ökologischen Ackerbau mit konservierender Bodenbearbeitung
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dorn, Brigitte
Jossi, Werner
van der Heijden, Marcel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weed management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In large-plot field trials leguminous cover crops were examined under conservation tillage systems in organic farming conditions for their ability to suppress weeds. Cover crops were directly drilled after wheat harvest into the field. Suitability of cover crop was estimated by assessing their growth, soil coverage, biomass, biomass of weeds, mulch layer and yield of the main crop, which was either maize or sunflower. Fast growing cover crops, which had a high biomass, reduced weed growth most. Any cover crops grown reduced weed biomass significantly compared to the control without cover crop. Effects on the main crops will be determined after harvest in autumn 2010.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Dorn, Brigitte; Jossi, Werner and van der Heijden, Marcel (2011) Leguminosen als Zwischenbegrünung im ökologischen Ackerbau mit konservierender Bodenbearbeitung. [Leguminous cover crops in organic farming systems with conservation tillage.] Poster at: 11. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Gießen, 15.-18. März 2011.
